newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian shares seen volatile before expiry.
newsitem.headline: Austrian shares seen volatile before expiry.

text.p: Austria's ATX index advanced a notch on Tuesday in meagre turnover and traders said they expect activity to remain volatile until futures expire.
August futures and options expire on Thursday, one day early due to a public holiday on Friday.
"Not much is really going to change -- although there could be some big intra-day fluctuations," said one trader.
The ATX index closed 0.33 percent or 4.71 points higher at 1,430.30 with 13 shares advancing and eight falling.
Traders said the ATX had formed a technical support at 1,430 points.
The ATX is seen settling between 1,430 and 1,440 points at expiry.
"The market will remain susceptible," said one trader, with investors becoming very cautious and buying centring on selective issues that had recently come under pressure, for example bank issues.
The day's best performer was cartonboard maker Mayr-Melnhof, which presents its first half figures on Tuesday. MMK rose 1.97 percent to 724 schillings.
Creditanstalt's preferred shares led decliners, losing 1.83 percent to 588 schillings.
The broad-based Vienna bourse index rose 0.14 percent or 0.73 points to 513.71.
The August ATX future fell 6.5 points to 1,420.5 on turnover of 4,329 contracts.
